Reviews.Title: A beutiful upgrade
Reviews.Author: Carlos
Reviews.Content: A beautiful upgrade for all samsung galaxy tab2 users, even though it seems that Tab 2 wifi adapter has more power, device it's soo stylish an good looking! faster also!, 100% recomemded for all amazon buyer.

Reviews.Title: Great for College/Highschool use!
Reviews.Author: Jov
Reviews.Content: I'm a college student, i use this tablet to access to my facebook, email accounts, bank accounts and study sessions in school. A busy student needs something like this, I also use this device to do my homework during my break at work due to its compact design its easy to put away without worrying about carrying something big or bulky. This tablet is a must for everyone, from kids to adults.

Reviews.Title: A GREAT WAY TO READ BOOKS AND MANY MORE
Reviews.Author: Julie
Reviews.Content: I have one of the older Kindles that doesn't have WiFi so I bought the Galaxy tablet so I could download library e books.  I've only had it for a few weeks to date but I'm so glad I got it.  I bought the 7" Galaxy Tab 3 because I want something very light weight and small enough to put into my purse.  It holds a charge for a long time and I can use it for multiple things i.e., computer, email, countless apps, etc.  I am very happy with my purchase and don't hesitate to recommend it.  It is very easy to use.  I had no trouble figuring out how to adjust the font.  It also has an easy way to see what page you're reading on, how many pages in the book total, how much time it will take to read to the end of the chapter.  It is easy to bookmark.  It also gives you the ability to adjust the brightness of the page.  All of these things are very easy to figure out.  I received it in less time than expected.

Reviews.Title: Very close to 5-stars...and an excellent tablet for the money
Reviews.Author: lovemyfamily
Reviews.Content: I own a 7" Kindle Fire HD, a 9" Kindle Fire HD, an iPad 1 and now this tablet.  I have also had various iPhones in the past but now own a Galaxy S4.  There's the background on what I'm familiar with.I didn't purchase my iPad 1 new...used on Craigslist.  I just can't bring myself to spend $500+ on a new iPad (even though they're nice) when there are a plenty of high-quality alternatives for less than half the price.  To stay on topic...I didn't purchase my Samsuny Galaxy Tab 3 7" on Amazon.  My local AT&T; retailer was offering a deal where if I upgraded my wife's phone (she had an iPhone 4 and wanted to join me and get a Galaxy S4) to an S4 they would give me a 'free' Tab 3 7" with 4G if I signed up for a $10/mo data plan.  So of course I went for the deal.Personally since I travel a bit I like 7" tablets.  They're easy to hold with one hand when reading on an airplane.  I like this one slightly better than the 7" Kindle Fire HD...same basic size but since I now own a Galaxy S4 phone I found navigating this tablet EXTREMELY easy.  It's basically a large version of my phone.The screen is great...great picture quality.  It was easy to sync pictures from my phone to the tablet wirelessly.  My google play music ported right over.  There's even an Amazon Kindle ap right on the tablet so all of the books I'd purchased from Amazon are now on my Tab 3 (no different functionally than if I was reading from one of my Fire's).  So that couldn't be more convenient.I give the device 4 stars (instead of 5) for two reasons:1.  Compared to other tablets, it seems like it longer than normal to charge.  The battery life is about the same as other tablets (longer life when using it to read, shorter when watching videos) so nothing negative there.  Using the provided Samsung charger, if the Tab 3 7" is around 5% battery life remaining it will take 3-4 hours to fully charge.  It seems long to me.2.  This may have nothing to do with the Tab 3 but I am annoyed that there is no app on the device for Amazon videos.  This ap exists on my iPad (so I can use my Prime membership to stream free movies/tv shows on my iPad) but it doesn't exists on my Galaxy S4 or this Galaxy Tab 3 7".  If Apple of all companies is allowing this ap on their iPad's (instead of forcing everyone to purchase content via the Apple store) why can't Google allow the same?  Beyond irritating.  I'm not purchasing stuff from the Google Play store when I can get it for free with my Prime account from my laptop.  Call me cheap but it irritates me.That's it.  It's a great tablet besides the two issues.  I can't imagine anyone purchasing one and not being happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Just very good
Reviews.Author: negrito
Reviews.Content: I just love this tablet it serves all my purposes very good if you not an expert in computing it is very easy to use like it a lot.

Reviews.Title: I love it!
Reviews.Author: oldandugly
Reviews.Content: I have the Galaxy S3 and the tablet is set up exactly like my phone. I love this tablet! Would definitely recommend this one. It is a great deal for the money!

Reviews.Title: Like it, but it has some issues
Reviews.Author: MP "M"
Reviews.Content: I saw several one star reviews for this tablet because it shut off and wouldn't come back on after only a short time of owning the tablet.  I gave this three stars because I love the tablet, but it lags and after owning it for only 2 months just yesterday it turned off (fully charged) and I could not turn it on.  But I want to say to those who have this issue I found a youtube video giving you two different ways that could possibly get your tablet back on.  I tried the very first one he recommended and it worked!!!  Thank goodness, I was starting to fear that I had wasted my money completely!Here is the youtube link, try it and I hope it works for those of you with this problem![...]

Reviews.Title: One of the best Android tablets for the money!
Reviews.Author: Chris F
Reviews.Content: I am a tech junky, I have two of these tablets currently. I bought them for my kids for Christmas gifts and my kids love them. I ama big fan of Samsung products, I own a Samsung Smartphone and LCD television and both of them work without any problems. I also own 4 tablets including two of these. I own an Ipad mini and my fiancee has a Windows Surface RT tablet. I feel as though android is the easiest operating system to learn so I figured these would be best for my children. Ok on with the review.PROSPrice - usually if you search hard enough you can find one of these for around $150. Which is a steal for a Samsung tablet. Alot of other android tablets you can find cheaper but they are cheaply made. I prefer Samsung cause I know my product will last.Learning Curve - Android is by far the easiest operating system to learn. My kids were already playing with my android phone before they got their tablets for Christmas so they already knew how to use them. If you can use a smartphone you can use this tablet.Resolution - I have compared this tablet to other android tablets side by side. The brightness and quality of the colors on this far exceed any other android tablets I have seen. Every Samsung tablet is so bright and colorful compared to say a Lenovo tablet. I was told by a Samsung rep that they use the same material to make all of their LED tv screens and Touchscreens so that is probably why it looks so good.Good Camera - Alot of tablets have a low quality camera. This one seems to take clear pictures whether facing front or rear. `Battery Life - I am a big fan of long battery life. I hate having to recharge my devices all the time. I have noticed my kids can play on these for around 6-8 ours before a charging is needed. I feel as if that far exceeds my expectations.Touchscreen response - Touchscreen responds well. You don't have to touch things twice or press down too hard. It responds perfectly to swipes and presses.Case availability - Because this is a Samsung product it is very easy to find a case for this tablet. Of course you can get the Samsung brand case but even if you want an off brand or knock off case you will have no trouble finding one for this model. I found cases for $15.Processor - This has a 1.2 GHZ dual core processor in it. It is quick enough for anything I could imagine doing on it. Youtube, Netflix, and streaming music all work without a hitch. Games download and play fine also. Plenty of speed for the money.Memory card slot - some android tablets still don't have memory card slots. Samsung always includes one so you can expand memory.CONSI couldn't find much wrong with this tablet. Here are the few things I could think of that I didn't like.Hard drive space - Only 8 gigs of internal hard drive space. I guess that is enough for a casual user but I prefer at least 16 gigs of internal memory. Especially when 1-2 gigs are already being used when you buy it. Of course you can add a memory card to it and this problem can be solved.Bloatware - This tablet comes included with quite a bit of "Bloatware". Bloatware is programs that are pre-installed before you purchase your computer/tablet. I find the bloatware on this tablet to be excessive as compared to say the Nexus tablet.That is about it for the cons. Overall i give the Samsung Tab 3 5 out of 5 stars. I seriously cannot suggest a better 7 inch tablet. If you are only trying to spend around $150-$175 then go no further because this tablet is for you. There are cheaper android tablets out there but what you are paying for here is the Samsung seal of quality. Instead of buying the $100 Lenovo or Asus android tablets spend the extra $75 and get this. You won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: Fulfills its purpose as an e-reader+
Reviews.Author: Amanda
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research before choosing to buy a tablet to use as an e-reader, and chose this one because of its size, price, and the fact I've always been very happy with Samsung products. The expandable memory allows a MicroSD card to expand the memory from the default 8GB for significantly less than it would cost to buy an e-reader or tablet with those same internal specs. The height and width dimensions are roughly the same as a mass-market paperback and are perfect for carrying it around on a daily basis and fitting in my purse.The Android OS lets me install all the apps I need for what I read. Along with several news and magazine apps, I use reading apps for Kindle, Nook, Aldiko, and Kobo, and I'm confident I'll be able to find whatever else I'll need in the future to consolidate all my e-books in one place. Each app operates independently, so I can download reading material directly from the internet to the app or device or update my libraries with what I purchase using a computer or other device. The Dropbox app makes a good middleman for getting free books from Project Gutenberg or documents from other sources to Aldiko.The way the tablet is set up physically makes it perfect for e-reading. There is a button on the lower left which gives different options based on the app being used, and the back button on the lower right toggles you back from the book to the library. To use the Kindle and Nook apps as examples, once the apps are up and running, you would not know you were on an Android tablet and not on a dedicated Kindle or Nook device.Of course, there are other perks to having a tablet, including being able to hook up to free wifi for internet browsing and email, games, Google maps, music, weather, other cool Android apps (which are very similar, if not identical, to iOS apps), widgets, and the front/back camera. The screen has the option for automatic brightness adjustment, so you're not always fiddling in the settings to make it comfortable to see.

Reviews.Title: Great Product.
Reviews.Author: ColdsteelSoldier1
Reviews.Content: I love it the screen is amazing watching HD movies, the price was awesome.  I only wish the battery lasted a little longer.

Reviews.Title: Cool but Tab 2 was better
Reviews.Author: Ana
Reviews.Content: For the price it's ok... but sometimes it lags a loooooot... it's annoying, waiting for the updated kit kat OS for it to be faster.

Reviews.Title: Cool little tablet
Reviews.Author: L. Pombo "felinelvr"
Reviews.Content: I ordered this tablet because I have a ASUS Memo HD that has spent more time getting repairs, than actually being used. The Samsung on the other hand is a nice little 7 inch tablet, though 8 gigs of space turns into about 5 gigs of space and google only lets you load apps on the device. So the space fills up fast. I did learn to move my Audible books to the SD card and I can load most but not all my apps on this device. This device isn't as zippy as I thought it would be. But overall I like the tablet. I think the sweet spot for this type of tablet would be 16 gigs and SD expansion to 64 gigs is prefect hence the 8 inch tablet. But I wanted something smaller than my 10 inch tablets, and something I could just throw in my purse and listen to my audiobooks or read my e-books or listen to music etc. I am not crazy about Googles/Android web browsers and the whole Flash issues. My iPad I can visit news websites and watch the video, but you can't on a android tablet without a big hassle. iPads do not support Flash, but I can still watch the video???? But that is just an Android gripe. I did install Flash and it seems to work ok....Overall this is a good tablet so far, for the light user and with careful installation you can move some data to a memory card and make this thing more usable. But if you love your apps and need space get a different tablet.

Reviews.Title: Small, fast affortable
Reviews.Author: Ann Whitaker
Reviews.Content: I love it, it is easy to hold, fast, clear screen holds almost all the apps that my Samsung phone holds and they can be sync together.

Reviews.Title: Favorite tablet!
Reviews.Author: Traci
Reviews.Content: Have an iPad, but was curious about the Samsung tablet.  My husband got one first and I really liked it. Seems fitting, since I have a Samsung phone. So glad I bought this! I am selling the ipad!

Reviews.Title: If I could give it 5 and a half stars, I would!
Reviews.Author: B. Roth
Reviews.Content: I researched tablets extensively online before purchasing this one.  There was a certain budget and size I wanted to stay in, and when all was said and done this fit the bill.  I was taken aback at some of the reviews I read about it being slow or dying all of a sudden.  Of course I don't have a crystal ball, but as to the latter I'd say if you purchase a tablet with a lithium battery and certain sensibilities, it's good to take the time to read and heed the instruction manual and treat it accordingly, especially regarding charging. If I'm not mistaken (and I don't think I am), it comes with a one-year manufacturer's warranty. All this aside, compared to other tablets in the same class, Samsung's build quality and reliability seem unparalleled.  If it just up and dies on someone, I'd say it' s a manufacturing anomaly and not the norm.  People misuse and mishandle these tablets and then complain that it's junk, but I do believe there's more to those stories than meets the eye.Anyway, the funny thing is that I used my husband's Samsung Galaxy Tab 2 7.0 to do my research.  This was over a period of a couple of weeks, and as I went along searching and researching I came to like and trust the little gizmo.  He's had it for over a year now.  No problems!  It runs like a medium-grade laptop.  Sometimes it will take a second or two to go from one web page to another, or sometimes (I think because it's so small) you have to tap a couple of times to hit a link just right, but please.  Come on.  That's not slow.  That's not horrible.  That's fine.  It's good quality.  It's a Toyota.  It's not a Porsche.The display is beautiful.  The sound is remarkably nice, nice enough to listen to without a bluetooth speaker while you're puttering.  Both ways, depending on your preference at the moment, it works great.The Dolphin Browser, I find, is awesome to use on it if you dislike certain mobile apps as do I.  You can add your favorite websites to your speed dial and just go there.As for it running slowly, again, treat it as you would a $400-$500 laptop.  Clear the cache and make sure you don't have a jillion apps running all at once.  The Active Applications widget  and Clean Master app are awesome for doing this very easily and quickly.I've only used the camera a couple of times, but for casual picture taking I'd say it's quite good!  If you want something fancy, buy a camera.  Duh.In summary, if you're looking for a portable, reliable (and, I must say, very attractive and well-built) tablet you can carry around with you to watch movies and TV shows, check email, play light games, listen to music, visit your favorite websites, read, chat, Skype, etc., etc., you really can't go wrong with this baby!  It's not an iPad, and it won't open your garage door or wash your dishes, but it is a remarkably versatile device, and I'd say it's priced well.  Amazon's dropped the price lately, so keep an eye on that.  It's comparable to the price of the Lite version (which also looks excellent), but why get lite when you can get full fat?I could not be happier with my purchase.  If that changes, I'll let you know, but I don't think it will.

Reviews.Title: Dead after only 2 months But I found how to fix it
Reviews.Author: Jack
Reviews.Content: and you cant return it and now will cost to try to get fixed, if it can be fixed.  Do not buy this product unless you like to gamble.UPDATE: I was able to get it working again.  I had to take the back cover off and unplug the battery, then plug it back in, put the cover back on and plug in the charger and it Worked!  had to charge it fully before using.  TAKE AWAY: DO NOT LET THE BATTERY DRAIN TO ZERO.  If you plug in the charger when it warns you it is at 15%, then you shouldn't have any issues with it not working again. The TAB 3 is a great tablet and you are able to do so much with it.  BUT it would have been nice if Samsung had a warning on how the battery should not be drained to ZERO.  THis would prevent so many headaches and a bad user experience.

Reviews.Title: I just received it today
Reviews.Author: Crystal
Reviews.Content: i just already love it, its perfect size for me. Not to big and not to small. Thank you guys

Reviews.Title: Great Product!!
Reviews.Author: Abigail Olson
Reviews.Content: My grandmother bought this as a surprise for me, its awesome. It looks small but picture quality and size, is great. My Fiance has the Kindle Fire and he wants mine now lol. We held the Fire and Galaxy next to each other and they were the same length but the width was smaller on this but it is still awesome!!

Reviews.Title: Update: Fixed It!  (Stopped Working 6 weeks after delivery)
Reviews.Author: TimG "TimG"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my daughter. It stopped working 6 weeks after delivery. Too late to return it. I will seek support from Samsung on how to fix the problems.Update 3/2/14 I followed the directions on the Samsung site of things to try and get it working again. One was to plug it in for one hour and then hold the on button down for 5 seconds. It booted up and works great. My daughter had already tried this a couple of times and it did not work for her. For now, the problem is resolved and I am sending it back to her. I am changing from one star to three (not 5 as it did stop working).

Reviews.Title: Samsung Galaxy Tab 3 (7 inch)
Reviews.Author: adharris
Reviews.Content: I ordered the Gold-Brown one but received the black in instead, which was the first time I ever had that problem.  I have another Galaxy through Sprint that I pay $15.00 a month for.  This has no monthly fee and works great with my internet service inside my home or outside.  I order this one for my daughter  as well as Chromecast, she loves it!

Reviews.Title: Great tablet
Reviews.Author: Carlos García
Reviews.Content: I've tried quite a few tablets and truth, I'll take this. I used larger tablet, and small, of different brands and my experience with it is simply wonderful.If you want a tablet to check email, have fun, watch a series or other options and not have to be with her 24 hours is ideal. Screen very fluid, very fast, the keyboard is great ... ReadThe price is a major advantage and brand Samsung also when if something happens. Also it should be noted that being a brand so famous and such, accessories are more common and you can find any easily.If you do not need to be 24 hours in front of the tablet, good price and want to carry with ease and fluidity, is your tablet.

Reviews.Title: I Love this little tablet
Reviews.Author: stone artist "abstraction"
Reviews.Content: I had been looking at tablets for some time and decided on this smaller tablet. It's just the right size for me. I can carry it in my purse and it does everything that I want it to. It's fast and works great. I listen to books and music on it. Just love it. Got it for the lower cost and because Samsung has the ability to add up to 64 gb of memory to the tablet.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Randy O'Brien "Randy O'Brien"
Reviews.Content: The screen is great and the programs load very quickly. I even like the sound it produces. You won't go wrong buying this one.

Reviews.Title: So need a microsd card
Reviews.Author: Rozo A. "A beautiful wind."
Reviews.Content: Ok so 8gb isn't enough for me, after awhile the lack of space slows the hardware down (as with most things)I brought this for myself as a belated birthday presentThe operating system is great runs smooth and vividly.My favorite feature is the S Voice (It's samsung's version of Siri), just wish there was an option to make it masculine.It charges fast which I really like and it lasts long. Normally I would unplug it around 11am and won't plug it back in until 4-6am , with extensive use.Skype does run the battery down a bit.So far the power saver feature causes freezing with facebook messenger and skype.It's great for spanish lessons and bookclub readingJust brought my mum one for my birthday yesterday this way she could watch her favorite shows on the go.No real problems, other than memory but that is a simple fix. Microsd cards go on sale around back to school deals.Try it out and see for yourself, it's a great tab for a great price.p.s. you can control the font size so there's no true "size" problem.

Reviews.Title: My parents love it!
Reviews.Author: Kyle
Reviews.Content: Got this for my parents because they don't have smartphones. They're still getting used to it but they love it so far. Mom is addicted Candy Crush. Woops.

Reviews.Title: Hidden flaw
Reviews.Author: LPG
Reviews.Content: Recently I discovered a problem that seems to occur with this tablet. When you run the battery down where it turns off ( as when your children are gaming) the first thing would be to plug in and charge. However it seems a flaw in the charging system has become evident. The tablet may lock down and not restart ( completely dead). It may restart ( with reset) and may not. Words of Caution 1: do not let it become totally discharged. 2: back up all file ( music and photos). 3: Monitor charge time instead of allowing auto off to stop charging process.Hope Samsung addresses the problem with charing system.

Reviews.Title: Looks good but underperforms
Reviews.Author: Kwame A. Lewis
Reviews.Content: This tablet is has potential but lags on the WiFi and is slow on routine operation. Recommend the Nexus 7 at this price or the Kindle HD

Reviews.Title: Awesome Tablet!
Reviews.Author: andrea harless
Reviews.Content: We got 4 of these tablets for Christmas gifts for the kids.  They are amazing!  They work flawlessly, great battery life, very useful.  I would highly recommend this tablet to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: Best gift we have ever given!
Reviews.Author: Carlene Inge "passion reader"
Reviews.Content: Within 2 weeks of giving this as a gift to my dad who is retired - he has been enchanted with all the features, the convenience.  He loves that with a wireless router he can sit in the living room with mom  and play his games, read his e-mails and check his stocks and not have to sit alone in his office at his computer.  The quality is good and with all the apps the opportunities to learn and discover is endless. Dad is 81 and his mind is very, very sharp.  This will keep his mind active and healthy.  He loves it!

Reviews.Title: Samsung Galaxy Tab 3
Reviews.Author: ShadowHatter
Reviews.Content: This tablet is a fabulous toy. Works great and I love the fact that I can use an external bluetooth enabled keyboard to help with it. I also love the operating system because of the fact that it is so similar to the operating system on my phone. Great buy, highly recomend!

Reviews.Title: Battery goes bad when completely discharged
Reviews.Author: Sherif  M.
Reviews.Content: In general I like SAMSUNG products especially their Android devices. I have the Samsung Galaxy SII cell phone and it's great.On 3/14/2014, I bought two SAMSUNG Galaxy Tab3 for my two children.On 5/9/2014: One of them got completely discharged then it stopped getting charged when I connected it to its charger. I tried different chargers and cables and still no response. called the support as it was still under warranty and went through the steps with them pressing the button combinations as instructed by the support representative. Then he told me to send it for repair. I sent it.Today 5/19/2014: Today, the other one had the same issue. Called SAMSUNG. They told me to send it for repair and gave me the shipment label.The device itself is very good when it works. But it's a big flaw that the battery goes bad if it's completely discharged and it's not user replaceable. If I replaced it as shown on many videos online, I would've lost the warranty and replacing it needs screw drivers and some not so easy steps to disconnect the battery from the motherboard then reconnect the new one.They should've made the battery as reliable and user friendly as their cell phones to be able to change it without losing the warranty. But again a battery that goes bad upon complete discharge is unforgivable in a device like this. I always thought that one of the advantages of the SAMSUNG Galaxy cell phones over the iPhone is the ability to change the battery without needing to give your phone to Apple then get a refurbished one and go through backup and restore. Now that's the case with the Galaxy Tab3.

Reviews.Title: Terrible buy! I feel both amazon and Samsung Company has robbed my money.
Reviews.Author: NAOMI
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet as a Christmas gift for my daughter, and havent been able to use it properly. The tablet came with charging issues and does not charge. I bought a new charger (original) thinking i would solve the issue but no, I contacted Amazon and they refered me to the supplier "Samsung" who says the are not responsible for things sold by Amazon! What the heck i dont understand , at the end I paid for a product that its not working and it seems as i cant complain since no one is responsible. I am very dissapointed with both companies.

Reviews.Title: Same on Samsung!
Reviews.Author: J. Calderon "JONZI216"
Reviews.Content: shame on samsung for putting out such a crappy tabet. I purchased 2 as christmans gifts, this tablet lacks normal performance,  very laggy, crappy cameras, crappy resolution, and god forbid you add apps! they will lag, freeze or crash. these "paper weights" are going right back!  not worth the aggrivation , please keep clear of this garbage.

Reviews.Title: Awesome little tablet.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I love love love this tablet!  I have a Kindle Fire HD (7") which I also love, but my three year old has claimed it as his own, so I was in need of a suitable replacement.  I did not purchase this item from Amazon, but through Sprint, who is offering the tablet for $49.99 with a two-year data plan (I have absolutely no intention of using the data plan, but at $5/month, it works out to be a cheaper alternative than shelling out over $200 for a tablet with only half the memory).This tablet has every feature that I would ever want in a tablet.  The size is perfect--it is lightweight, but feels comfortable and sturdy while holding it.  It has an Android platform, so virtually every app is available for it (except those exclusive to Apple).  I have used it to watch movies, play games, and listen to music--and everything is just amazing.  I will, however, concede to the views of others regarding to the placement of the speaker...sound is great in portrait mode, not so great in landscape...so you might want to use headphones.  I have had no issues with the resolution of the screen, but I am no expert, so I wouldn't know if the display was inferior.It is VERY easy to use right out of the box.  Just set it up and go.  Highly recommend this tablet!!  :)

Reviews.Title: nice tablet don't litsen to people can't please!
Reviews.Author: dogg 40
Reviews.Content: What a nice tablet it has a better screen then my galaxy 3 phone prerty fast to well worth the money buy one you won't regret it don't litsen to bad reveiws this thing rocks

Reviews.Title: Nothing to do compared to the S phones
Reviews.Author: tesia971
Reviews.Content: Hi, I bought this tablet as a promotion from my local cable company, I was expecting something outstanding, like the S3 did in its time, but it's completely the opposite.It's just too slow, if I play a video game sometimes it freezes, to be more precise playing Candy Crush Saga, as well as other games.When I open a Chrome window and click the address bar at the top, I've counted up to 5 seconds for the keyboard to appear and the lagging it has when using other apps just makes it awkward to use.My daughter (10 yrs old) calls it the blocked tablet, because it's always freezing on her.I also have a Playbook from Blackberry which is faster than the Samsung, and it was release in 2011.My recommendation, don't buy it, spend a little more on a Nexus 7 or the iPad mini.

Reviews.Title: WAY too underpowered for the price
Reviews.Author: Jacob B
Reviews.Content: 1024x600 screen? Dual-core 1.3ghz processor? 3MP fixed-focus camera without flash? The $130 Sero 7 Pro from Walmart has a 1280x800 screen, 5mp camera with flash, mini-hdmi, quad-core 1.3ghz processor, microSD, micro USB (pretty universal). Sorry, Samsung. You could do much better.

Reviews.Title: I love it!
Reviews.Author: fun, as far as I can tell
Reviews.Content: I was so hesitant to purchase this tablet after some pretty poor reviews, however.....I did buy it, and am so glad I did. I have had no problems what so ever with this tablet.  It's quick to access pages on the internet, the 3-4g works great when we are out and about.  The screen is great to look at, I mean it's not hd like my fire however I notice very little difference.  It's small and much thinner and lighter than my fire which makes it nice to carry around.  I have had no trouble with battery life, I was surfing quite a bit the first 2 days and only recharged it one time.  The camera leaves little to be desired, but for the price you have to sacrifice something.  I have yet to have it freeze up on me while surfing around.  I will be purchasing a larger memory chip at some point.  I haven't watched any movies or youtube so I really can't give any information as to how well that works.  All in all I love it at this point.  A great little tablet for the price.  Sprint is actually running a promotion right now, 50$ for the tablet and I pay 15$ a month for the data plan.  Much cheaper than a smart phone!!!  One more thing, I went on Amazon, bought a great case, screen protector and stylus all for 10$ so make sure wherever you buy your tablet doesn't try to rob you blind for these items :)

Reviews.Title: WOW!!!!
Reviews.Author: chris Borgman
Reviews.Content: WOW!!! Incredibly fast, and very relevant! gift for my little brother, (age 8) and he has a ton of apps on it already and it still runs very fast! I definitely recommend it, and I may get one for myself! I got it on a Sunday!!!!

Reviews.Title: Soo slooow .....
Reviews.Author: Zombie_WMD
Reviews.Content: I bought this device at BestBuy, it's the same price as Amazon.  I come from an Apple iPad.  Compared to the iPad's snappy response, this device's response times are almost unbearable.  I suspect it's a combination of the device and the Android operating system.  Ironically, the worse response times are on the Internet using Google's own Chrome.  I impatiently hit a button again and again, while unrealized by me, the first button is still being processed.  Needless to say, this causes problems with screen processing.  Also, typing into the address bar is a stilted process as the screen update appreciably lags behind the keyboard input.  These things were never a problem on my iPad.Having said that, the 7" device is worth the $200.  I bought it for only a few dedicated reasons; 1) as an e-reader, it's a better bargain than the Kindle Paperwhite as you do get the Android OS and a better bargain than the Kindle Fire as you get a more generic flavor of Android, 2) as a IR blaster for controlling my home theater it has more battery life than my iTouch and a better form factor than my iPad, and 3) as an e-mail reader there are a number of Android replacement e-mail apps, a sorely lacking alternative in iOS.So all in all, it's a good price point device.  I'm just glad I didn't buy the 8" or 10" model.  As an aside, I find some system commands in Android to be a lot clumsier than in iOS, but that's probably a function of familiarity.Amazon review updateAffter living with this device for a couple of weeks, my major complaint is that surfing the internet is agonizingly, criminally, unforgiveably slow.  A frustrating and demeaning experience.  If you remember trying to do anything on the internet with a 1200 baud dial up modem, you know what I mean.  Why this should be I don't know.  It might have to do with the lack of memory, although if this were the case powering off and on should make a difference, which it doesn't.  It's so frustrating I used my iPad to update this review.If surfing is what you want, spend the extra $100 and get an iPad mini.

Reviews.Title: Nice machine but....
Reviews.Author: Ernie
Reviews.Content: Quick, powerful, expandable storage to 64 gb, but they've stupidly stinted on the memory (8gb) and have the blasted thing engineered so you can't move large programs (like Bard's Tale or some of Square-Enixes games) to get the full use of that 64gb microsd. They've also loaded a bunch of useless for me crapware that wastes the meager 8gb from the get-go. This was supposed to replace a Nook HD, but the only thing it has better is front and rear cameras and that's not really enough so I'm debating sending it back.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet, but...
Reviews.Author: Sannam
Reviews.Content: This tablet is very good, I love it and it's so cute! It's easier to hold and bring along with you anywhere you go, other than the 10 inch tablets. The quality is very durable and I know it will not break so easily.My only 2 problems with this tablet is that the camera does not have flash, which sucks, because flash is always needed just incase. Another problem is that it's a bit laggy, sometimes when scrolling down things or flipping through things.Overall, beautiful tablet =]

Reviews.Title: Proprietary Charger and a little heavy
Reviews.Author: U2pop "u2pop"
Reviews.Content: We purchased this tablet for my company to use in the testing of Android apps. When I got it in the mail the home screen button was broken, but a quick trip to my local Best Buy to swap solved that problem. As I got to using it, though, I was surprised by 4 key points, but first some caveats: I use an iPad and I have a Galaxy S4 phone.1. Heavy. At 7 inches, compared to the iPad 10 inch, it's pretty hefty.2. You can ONLY use Samsung chargers. No third party chargers allowed. This is practically a deal breaker for us and we're thinking about taking it back because of it.3. The layout of everything is markedly different than the S4. Confusing even.4. Like it's bigger and smaller cousins the Galaxy Tab 3 is BLOATED with junk-ware. Software that Samsung and others installed that you cannot uninstall. At this point even if you are tech savvy and know what you're doing you can't uninstall those apps. That's a problem b/c it takes up space and gets in the way.With those points aside let's get another thing straight: As yourself why you're buying this tablet. We chose it because it was the cheapest of the "Reliable" Android tablets. Those points may be good for some but for the masses it will probably disappoint.We really should have gone for that extra inch and gotten the 8 inch. Some people may be satisfied with 7 inches but when you're use to an iPad that extra 1 or 3 inches (depending on model) really makes a difference. Not just on ease of us but clarity, eye strain, reading, etc. The overall size makes it good for fitting in a purse, or heck even cargo pants, but bigger is .. well..nice!Moving around the menus can be a little awkward if you're use to other Android devices. Items such as security and applications features are not where you expect them to be. This is probably due to only having Android 4.1 Jelly Bean (API level 16). The Galaxy S4 comes with 4.2.2. So perhaps with a little update at some point things will get better. The cameras are pretty bad. It's baffling why the S4 has a 13 MP camera, and the Galaxy Tab 3 only has a Front 1.3MP, Rear 3MP. Pretty much useless for photo taking - which is odd because it's small enough to use just fine.All in all though, if you're getting something for business that you need to be a cheap Android tablet, without much bells and whistles, this is a good product choice. You're going to really hurt in buying those proprietary chargers, in the steep learning curve and lugging it around, but it's cheap. You've got all the standard apps out of the box: Calendar, music, photo management, weather, document creation, etc. If you're committed to Android but see yourself as a power/business user, go for the 10 incher. If you're not tech savvy, if you like bigger screens, ease of use, flexibility with third party chargers, and in particular if weight is important, you should probably choose the iPad.

Reviews.Title: so glad to went back to android
Reviews.Author: K. smith
Reviews.Content: the ipad was great just not my style, i love the freedom of android and this tablet gives it to me, on 4g Lte ATT it's fast no doubt. smaller than ipad and easier to carry and used everyday~ lightweight and fantastic Samsung menu and quality, books are downloaded within seconds from kindle app. bit of the normal bloatware on it but i either uninstalled or stopped from loading if i don't use it. thanks again Amazon and Samsung!!

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Traci Bohl
Reviews.Content: Great product and investment.  I don't have a smart phone, so this is great to have no matter where I am.

Reviews.Title: Convenient tablet
Reviews.Author: genna "Genna"
Reviews.Content: Handheld tablet easy to carry. Lots of Andriod APPS, recommend for children and adults. Pocketbook size tablet, has camera, video, music and stores pics

Reviews.Title: Touch Screen is not very good.
Reviews.Author: Enrique A. Peyro "Henry"
Reviews.Content: Sometimes touch screen is not accurate and sensitive as expected. In general is a regular product but do not expect too much of it.

Reviews.Title: excellent
Reviews.Author: Denyses Dun
Reviews.Content: I'm very  very happy with my Samsung Galaxy Tab 3, it's very fast and elegant, i love it! 100 recommended!

Reviews.Title: Samsung Galaxy Tab 3
Reviews.Author: bk
Reviews.Content: More than I expected!  The screen is clear and colors vibrant.  Tablet holds a charge for a long time.  Easy to use right out of the box. Works well for watching Netflix.  Just the right size for my needs, i.e. portable.  I can carry it in a purse or small bag.I also ordered a screen protector and inexpensive case so the tablet is protected.  I love it!

Reviews.Title: Good starter tablet at a great price
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: We bought two of these so our twins could Skype with Grandma and read at the same time without fighting. My husband has a S3 phone and is familiar with the operating system. I have an iPhone, so I'm unfamiliar with Android devices. I'm learning to use it and it's great. I have Nook and Kindle apps, Facebook, email, and tv apps on mine. My mom loves to read and take pictures with hers.For the price, it is a great value.

Reviews.Title: Much better than I thought it would be!
Reviews.Author: Lothos
Reviews.Content: I purchased this Galaxy Tab 3 right after the Tab 4 was announced.  I was originally looking at the Nexus 7, which has much better specs, but didn't purchase it because Square and other credit card readers aren't fully compatible.  They're compatible with the Tab 3 which is why I purchased this one, and I got the Tab 3 on sale for a really nice price.I do photography, and needed something to show photos on, and was originally worried about the low resolution screen not being good enough but it looks really nice in person.  The tablet feels snappy and quick and I've only rarely noticed any lag on it.  It works great as an ebook reader.While I was hesitant at first, after receiving the tablet I'm quite satisfied with it.

Reviews.Title: Geat Tablet, be careful of Amazon's fake promotion
Reviews.Author: Mei
Reviews.Content: Pros: The tablet works well, very clear, just the right size to carry around without adding too much weight. Its been 3 days but i love itCons: Amazon promises to "Pre-loaded with free content including Hulu Plus membership, Google Play credit and Boingo Wi-Fi Access" Not true! theyre actually referring to the Free memberships we already get, there is no added benefit. Notice they dont even mention how much the google play credit will be. It was all very sneaky of Amazon and I am very surprised and disappointed with them

Reviews.Title: I LOVE MY TABLET

Reviews.Content: ITS EVERYTHING I COULD ASK FOR I LOVE IT. I ENJOY PLAYING MY GAMES AND READING MY BOOKS ON MY KINDLE APP. THANK YOU FOR A GOOS PRODUCT.

Reviews.Title: samsung tablet

Reviews.Title: good

Reviews.Content: I am using this tablet and it works great love it are recommended to anyone it is easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Satisfied

Reviews.Content: Satisfied with this purchase. Glad to recommend this product to anyone and the service I received was top notch.  A+

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: JESUS PICAZO
Reviews.Content: Excellent choice. Happy with all aspects of this product and highly recommended to others. Enjoy it if you get the chance.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Value
