Reviews.Content: Nice,  my wife is very love it, she said better than apple.  So I will recommended to my apples friends. Tell them to stop Soho apple

Reviews.Title: On a Second Chance!
Reviews.Author: Wil Evans "Wil"
Reviews.Content: At first we got a technical problem regarding turning on when I bought this Samsung Galaxy 3. But when I exchange it to another one, it gives me a wonderful  time to use this. The graphics are clear, even the sound is great. I like this samsung galaxy for web browsing.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet
Reviews.Author: Al.
Reviews.Content: I was not sure I would like the 7.0 form factor but have found it to exceed all my expectations. the screen clarity and brightness are terrific. I prefer it over a full size iPad.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Michael P. Holahan
Reviews.Content: Love Samsung - this thing works great and is holding up to the daily barrage of usage the teens are throwing at it.

Reviews.Title: Good Buy
Reviews.Author: J_Onyx "I never let my schooling interfere wi...
Reviews.Content: Despite the opinion of a few posted here, This Galaxy Tab3 7" tablet is certainly a real upgrade. I enjoyed using a Tab 2 7" for well over a year but this Tab3, which I purchased for my grandson, surprised him and me. I gave my tab2 to his younger sister two months ago. They both love it. When I gave the Tab3 to my grandson for his birthday, we were all impressed. We thought the Tab2 was well built and has a sharp display. The Tab3 is clearly significantly thinner and lighter and the display is impressive!Samsung makes good products for at a competitive price. You will not go wrong with a Tab3 7".I gave mine away simply because a full sized tablet suits me better.

Reviews.Title: Looks good but not much different than the cheaper Tab 2
Reviews.Author: Matthew Yaple
Reviews.Content: I have owned the Galaxy Tab 2 7.0 for a little while now, and this one (Galaxy tab 3.0) isn't a whole lot different, it comes with a slightly faster processor physical buttons for home, back, and menu which gives a little more screen space, along with some more minor features. A nice tablet but if you want to save a few bucks get the Galaxy tab 2 7.0 you can get it for $170 new and about $130 used from here Samsung Galaxy Tab 2 (7-Inch, Wi-Fi)

Reviews.Title: grest tablet easy to use
Reviews.Author: charlie
Reviews.Content: Very happy with this tablet its very easy to use, compact ligyt weight, the battery lasts for ages and the screen is superb

Reviews.Title: Nice tablet.
Reviews.Author: Diane C
Reviews.Content: The fact that Adobe Flash Player is not supported is a drawback. I can't look at some video clips on Facebook. I have not had time to look for a solution to that. I am sure I haven't been using the device to its full potential, but mainly need it for communication and web access. Dropbox access helps keep necessary information at hand.

Reviews.Title: Basically a good tablet, but missing some key components
Reviews.Author: Larry Vance
Reviews.Content: I already have the 7" Tab 1. It is basically the same without the sim card slot or the Swype keyboard. One thing that neither have and should be corrected is compatibility with flash player. The processor is an upgrade and does help, but I would advise getting the 8" model for faster processing.

Reviews.Title: Lemon On Day 1
Reviews.Author: Mary C Cooper
Reviews.Content: What a disappointment.  I opened it yesterday. It ran for awhile.  I charged it overnight. It still is not working.  Very disappointed.  I can send it in but wanted it for a trip.  Makes me question the quality.  Maybe I have a dud or lemon.  Wish Samsung would provide a new product versus fixing this lemon.

Reviews.Title: Poor Wifi speed, sites detect it as a cell phone!
Reviews.Author: K. Winter
Reviews.Content: This is like a giant galaxy s4 but is slooooowwwww! I own 3 other tablets and multiple computers for user testing. This is by far the worst I have tried. Despite loving my galaxy s3 and being a Samsung fan in general I had to send this back for the following reasons.Major faults with this tablet:1) Sloooooowwwww, much slower than even my s3 cell phone.2) Poor resolution, means newer responsive websites detect this tablet as a cell phone in portrait mode. Incredibly annoying.3) Wifi is very poor as well, spotty and jerky. A real deal killer.Summary:Half baked device that was not well thought out in the design process. Great idea, poor design.

Reviews.Title: the product is bad
Reviews.Author: Pablo Gavidia
Reviews.Content: the product is bad, there are no accessories available for my model, since the search buy an HDMI adapter and I have not been able to find so far, really believed that to be samsung better but not buy a USB adapter and it did not work, I totally dissapointed for purchases

Reviews.Title: Worst choice I ever made. Died in one week with no help from factory. Garbage!
Reviews.Author: A. C. Osse "TonyBR"
Reviews.Content: Worst choice I ever made. Check on the web about galaxy tabs that wont turn on. Mine, just one week old went to sleep and never returned. Samsumg support has no answer but tell you to take to service center.  My Ipad never gave me problems... The cheaper route took me to a literally DEAD end. Samsung never more. You get what you pay for. Into the trash in a few seconds... Oh, btw, im writing this review on an ipad....that works!!!POST MORTEN REVIEWOK, back to this one! Took it to a repair shop...  The guy just looked at it and said: Not turning on, right?  I said yes. He told me: get a better charger. The original one can't take it from hybernation when it get's to deep low energy levels.First I tought the guy was crazy (It's a tablet, not a bear!)...  but he seemd soo sure that I gave it a try. Bought his charger, left in the plug for 24 hours and.... it's back to life!!It's working right now, and it's very good for it's price and my use for it: check e-mails on trips basically!But I'll keep my 1 star because of the Samsumg NO-service!! They sure know the problem, as there are thousands of people talking about it on the net....  So why they just don't assume that the original charger is not good and tell us??

Reviews.Title: wifi
Reviews.Author: Marc807
Reviews.Content: Love the tablet but unless u in like same room where your router is then the wifi connection sucks had it freeze on me few times. I even upgraded my internet speed with a built in wifi it didn't help much really

Reviews.Title: A nice gift for my husband
Reviews.Author: Oslek "Amazon all the way!"
Reviews.Content: My husband complaint that he did not have a tablet... My kids have one each and I Have 2 (well, for anyone in the house to use).  But my husband wanted his own!  So, what a perfect gift for his birthday!  I have always liked Samsung products, and this one was just as I expected.  I added a memory card and loaded some movies and music; downloaded some games apps and others he may be interested and he is loving it.The tablet is fast (in my opinion) and the screen is nice and clear.  The camera works well (even though he does not use it much). Mainly at this point he uses it for movies and music, browse web, play a few games and skype.  A very good buy and simple enough for the beginner user.

Reviews.Title: Great graphics.
Reviews.Author: sbc "sbc"
Reviews.Content: I been looking for a nice 7 inch tab and this one is perfect!!! Great graphics, great sound, nice home button and much more memory by just adding a micro SD card. I love it!!! Samsung wins again!!

Reviews.Title: great tablet
Reviews.Author: Doodlebug22
Reviews.Content: I got this tablet yesterday, and so far it's been amazing! I've never owned a tablet before and I was trying to find something that could work for me. First I was looking into the Nexus 7 or the iPad Mini. However, since I'm a college student, the already installed word, power point and Excel seemed to grab my attention. The more I play with this tablet the more I like it. I like how I can upgrade this tablet with more memory whenever I want to instead of being stuck with one specific amount of data.I also liked that I didn't have to pay a lot for it, like I would have with the iPad Mini. Though sometimes I think the lighting needs some work, I still think the picture is very nice. Though there isn't very many accessories out yet, this product, I think is a very good purchase.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Carl B
Reviews.Content: Decided it was time for me too  own a tablet and began researching what I could afford on a budget. Already own a Samsung Galaxy S 3, and love it's  software and interface. When I saw this on Amazon, I was ecstatic!  Writing this review using my new Samsung Tab 3.  Works great for all my mobile computing needs.  Best purchase I've made all year!

Reviews.Title: Its OKay.
Reviews.Author: Tiffany Lugg
Reviews.Content: Every time a record my vids is would freeze for 30 or 20 mins!! This is very bad for a new device :(

Reviews.Title: I do not recommend this tablet as your primary tablet!
Reviews.Author: Reader2008
Reviews.Content: Update 05/31/2014: I took away a star because I bought this item USED not knowing that, if the battery ever is not charged (charges down to 0), the unit will cut off and have to be returned to the service center for repair.  I often let my units go to zero because I forget to charge them or don't want to OVERCHARGE them and burn out the battery.  This is very inconvenient to have to watch the charge; what if I am out of town or something?Also, I purchased this device for watching videos or reading in bed before I sleep.  The wi-fi is so sluggish that I end up using my IPAD MINI for that use, instead of the Samsung Tablet.I am so upset that Samsung messed up the tablet.---------------------------------------------------------------------ORIGINGAL REVIEW: I purchased the original Samsung Galaxy tab 3 years ago; it worked great. I dropped it getting out of the car last year and this year it finally just conked out - it starting blinking in and out after the drop.I decided to purchase THIS MODEL - T210R. The touch screen is either overly senstive or not senstive enough. You may touch a link and it may or may not open. THIS MODEL seems to have some internal issues. As a result of being annoyed with this model, I finally succumbed and purchased the IPAD Mini.The mini, I have discovered 100's of dollars later, is just a dumbed down version of the original Samsung Galaxy tablet. If I had known that, I would have just purchased another Galaxy Tab (original model) off ebay.Battery: Great; the battery life on the original Galaxy Tab is horrible; just existing caused the battery to drain. This model can lay around for days without needing to be chargedSize/weight: great size. It is flimsy though; the home button fell outValue for the money: Great cheap tablet if it is not your primary tablet; I would not recommend using this model as my primary tablet.Screen resolution: the pictures look pretty for the wallpaper and internet, but the photos don't look as pretty as the original galaxy tab; the lag, however, is gone thoughI use THIS MODEL for using wi-fi around the house.  For my serious tablet needs out and about, I use my IPAD Mini.Edited to add: I am ANTI-APPLE and it caused me great pains to finally get an Apple product.  I am disappointed that Samsung, making such an excellent first generation tablet, has dropped the ball on the current generation tablets.Would I recommend THIS Version? NOOOOOO, if you want a Samsung product go buy the first generation tablet or buy one of their phones.  If you want a tablet, go to the store and try out the various tablets, but don't get this one unless you just don't care.  This is my DON"T CARE about tablet.

Reviews.Title: I am furious!
Reviews.Author: Amanda Royse
Reviews.Content: I ordered this on March 12, 2014 received it a few days later. Everything was fine, until today (April 21, 2014) After turning my tablet off for the evening and letting it charge while I slept. I attempted to turn it on... NOTHING HAPPENED! Ok, my error.. checked the charger to make sure it was working (charged my phone just fine) so I left the tablet off for 2 hours and then tried charging it again. NOTHING. Ok, so I googled why my tablet wouldnt turn on and come to find out that its a very common problem that after 2 months they will QUIT turning on. There were various "Try this, Try that" claims that did not work. Now I have to send it back and wait 2 weeks for a new one! This is ridiculous! I paid for a device that I could use for more than 2 months!! If I had known all the issues I would have went with a different product. I have been a loyal Samsung customer for over 8 years and now Im seriously thinking Im over them. Thanks alot because now all my pictures and my work has been lost due to your crappy product. Instead of new "tricks" to fix the problem, why dont you STOP MAKING PRODUCTS THAT DEFECT AFTER 60 DAYS!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Great tablet but cannot update or download certain apps
Reviews.Author: Nikens T.
Reviews.Content: The reason why I'm giving this item 3 starts is because I cannot update the software and there is certain apps I cannot download in my play store. I might be because it's refurbished, I'm not too sure. Besides that very good tablet.

Reviews.Title: Stopped charging after 3 months - a waste of money
Reviews.Author: katymom
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed that the device stopped charging after only 3 months. The device was still under warranty, but Samsung would not repair it claiming "physical damage". The device was in a protective case from day 1 and very well taken care of. Samsung wanted to charge $99 to have the device repaired, which is almost the cost of what I paid for it brand new. I will stick to iPad, at least I know their customer service is always great.

Reviews.Title: refund
Reviews.Author: devar  cooper
Reviews.Content: Was promised a refurbished tablet got an old used broken tab 2 instead of a new tab 3 not buying from this seller again. Want my 139 gift card refunded now !!!!!

Reviews.Title: Lags
Reviews.Author: Toree
Reviews.Content: This product has a terrible lag to it when opening any app or even typing on it.  When I hit the home screen as well it takes 30 seconds to go to the home screen. I bought a SD card for it think that it would help but it did not.

Reviews.Title: PRINTING & EXTERNAL KEYBOARD USE BRAND-SENSITIVE
Reviews.Author: Caron Teenier
Reviews.Content: You may wish to reconsider making this purchase. This device will not print to any printer brand except its own. This is something very important. I was not aware of this at the time I purchased this unit. Another problem is that if you wish to use any other keyboard than Samsung, you may not make any adjustments for the board such as speed (I have a keyboard of another brand which has foreign language key popups if I type too fast. The manufacturer suggested that this is typicaI, but can be remedied by simply adjusting the speed of the keyboard on the tablet- SAMSUNG DOES NOT ALLOW FOR THIS). I bought this because of the price. It functions, but I wish I'd have known the peripherals. My recommendation: spend extra to get something that you can use to the full extent.

Reviews.Title: already broke, little to no use, does not charge the battery any more!

Reviews.Content: only 3 months of very light use and it broke, does not charge, and does not turn on. little piece of crap device. and i can not even return it.

Reviews.Content: Great buy for a 10 year old and a 13 year old. Cheap but still decent enough of a tablet to let them enjoy gaming.

Reviews.Title: Too S...L...O...W
Reviews.Author: Basil Nestor
Reviews.Content: I tried to like the Samsung Galaxy Tab 3 7-inch... Really, I did. I'm a Samsung fan. I own two Samsung phones, a Galaxy Blaze and a Galaxy S III, and I'm very happy with them. The Tab 3 looks like a larger version of the S3 on steroids. Unfortunately, it doesn't perform that way. It's slow doing simple things. For example, there is a noticeable lag when scrolling through web pages. And I don't mean loading pages, I mean scrolling AFTER the page is fully loaded! Move your finger, and for half-a-beat nothing happens, then the page moves. Very irritating, especially since my 18-month-old Blaze scrolls so much faster. This general slowness affects all of the Tab's operations to some degree (for example, when turning pages in a book or reading a pdf file). Even the menu for Settings, while faster than browser scrolling, still lags just a bit. C'mon, Settings is the most basic operation on the device!This slowness occurs even with no background apps running, or in memory.The shape and size of the device is quite pleasing, but the back is smooth shiny plastic with no texture, so it makes the Tab feel like a heavy toy. And the shiny finish magnifies fingerprints and smudges.Aside from slowness, everything works as advertised. But I get a sense that Samsung didn't try very hard when they were designing this device. It lacks vision. It's not revolutionary or evolutionary. The Tab 3 is a familiar form factor housing tech suited to 2011 or 2012 (dual core, 1200 MHz, ARM Cortex-A9 and 1024 x 600 pixels), but seriously out of date in 2013-2014. Ya, it's cheaper than some other tablets. And for this reason it might be a good gift for a child, or a tablet for someone on a very tight budget. But overall, I can't recommend.I kept the Tab for two days and then returned it. Got a Nexus 7 (2013 version), and it performs perfectly.Note that this review is for the WiFi-only version. The LTE version has slightly different specs and a different processor which may improve performance.

Reviews.Title: so far so good
Reviews.Author: doglady
Reviews.Content: I like this size. It's big enough to read and watch videos. The prize is a little bit higher than others, but I would like to try out Samsung because a lot of friends are using Samsung instead of Apple. It's much easier to use than Ios. I already have an iphone which makes me dizzy. I don't want my tablet to be that way.Its performance is so far so good. I'll update if something wrong happens.

Reviews.Title: Samsung Galaxy Tab 3
Reviews.Author: Essemmdee
Reviews.Content: This tablet is small enough to put in the cargo pockets of my shorts when strolling about, but the screen is also large enough to have plenty of area to work.  Samsung Galaxy, the name speaks for itself.  I am not a fan of all the requests for "cloud" type storage, this app and that app, but that isn't the device, it is part of the add on programming (apps).  Overall, I love it!

Reviews.Title: not bad for the price!!
Reviews.Author: DeDivaCaramel
Reviews.Content: i an enjoying this so far but with more flash memory and better screen resolution i would enjoy it even more i got it at the $179. so was happy about that but for basic usage which mine will be i would still say get it i got the white cause it just looks better to me still new so will play around with it some more but so far so good i like the 7" model easier to use with my small hands easy to tuck away in any purse your carrying just wish the resolution was better so pictures would show up true to color and such like thats the only disappointing part cause i use it for social network viewing pictures and not seeing them for the true color is abit off putting so thus the 4 stars....

Reviews.Title: Great tablet!
Reviews.Author: PPG
Reviews.Content: The Samsung Galaxy tab 3 (7 inch) has the perfect size, great quality and, awesome features! ... it's a Samsung! what else should you expect but the highest quality!

Reviews.Title: Excellent Tablet
Reviews.Author: Carolyn J. Tedder "CJ"
Reviews.Content: There is nothing you can't do with the Samsung Tablet.  The price is great. Very easy to navigate.  Great color image and lot's of fun. MUST HAVE!!

Reviews.Title: Good and Bad
Reviews.Author: D. Kaufmann
Reviews.Content: I bought a Galaxy Tab 3, 7.0.  I wanted to start to learn the Android OS so I knew both sides of the house when it comes to portable operating systems.My thoughts -8gb is not very much storage, but I bought a Nice 32gig compact flash drive for movies and music and that works well.The OS layout has lots of ways to customize it, with lots of neat widgets.  I like that.The Google play store doesn't seem to have quite as many good apps as the apple store.Dumping movies on the tab, having them be converted and play nicely is very cool and something I really enjoy, it removes pain in the ass steps that exist in the apple world.When running apps like facebook and ebay, there are moments when the system seems to slow down and need to catch up.  I find this unimpressive for a NEW NEW tablet to have so many slow downs.  There's a smoothness factor to the newer apple products that this simply lacks.  Maybe the 8.0 or 10.2 is better.I find typing on this tablet much better than on the Ipads / Iphones.I find surfing clunkier than on a lot of apple products, it feels like some of my touches just aren't that accurate.Does not weight a lot, but feels a bit cheap/plasticy.Cost me less than half of what an ipad mini costs.Nice for reading.I'm about a month into owning this tablet, and overall I like it, but don't LOVE IT.  Not a game changer, but if you don't wanna spend boku bucks... this is a good way to go.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful product
Reviews.Author: john simansons
Reviews.Content: We use the Galaxy Tab when we travel and for reading books, magazines and newspapers. It's very useful do quick web searches and catch-up on emails. This tablet is light and easy to use. It's much faster than anticipated. The colors are true and text extra crisp.

Reviews.Title: Nice choice

Reviews.Content: The Samsung Galaxy Tab 3, arrived on time and it works perfectly. My son loves it and can't take it off of his hands...The price was reasonable comparing to other retail stores. The navigation is so smooth that intrigued my baby daughter to navigate through all the screens and select her preferred app.

Reviews.Author: Terrey
Reviews.Content: tablet I got for my own personal use and I am quiet happy with it and has been very useful to me

Reviews.Title: I like it this product, very good

Reviews.Content: I like the product is well finished, has all the facilities listed in the features of the tablet and is easy to handle.

Reviews.Title: great

Amazon was the only place I could get the brown one.  I can't say much more as I haven't really got into it yet but the kids are doing fine. Reviews.Author: Stigmatized
Reviews.Content: Then it died after only seven days of moderate use. It was nice while it lasted, the only complaint I had prior to it's demise was the processor was a bit sluggish. Returned it and moved on...

Reviews.Content: Damn thing shuts off whenever it's connected to the internet  it over heats like seriously kmft waste of my money .... never again.

Reviews.Title: Maybe for a beginner
Reviews.Author: maximum verbosity
Reviews.Content: We are tech people in our house.  Tablets, i-devices, laptops, servers, gaming systems - we love all of it and with varying degrees of proficiency.  I have a Samsung Galaxy S3 and it's my favorite of all of the smartphones I've owned.  I've had a Kindle Fire & Nexus 7 in the "real" tablets, along with an array of off-brand tablets for my kids.  So, when my Nexus 7 tablet screen spontaneously cracked on Thanksgiving Day, I was immediately looking for a replacement (after the swelling in my eyes went down from crying about my beloved tablet).  I originally thought I'd get another Nexus because I've been really pleased with it.  But then I remembered it's 20 days until Christmas and I have 6 children to buy gifts for and looked for something that had good reviews, was a brand that I recognized and was in my price range.  Since I have a Samsung phone, I thought I'd love the tablet.I paid extra for Saturday delivery, anxious to get back to reading my books, playing my games and all the other things a person who has a lot of down time due to illness does.  Sadly, the delivery guys didn't bring it for 3 days after it was due to arrive!  So, they missed their delivery date and I was bummed.  When it finally arrived, I was so excited to get my newest little electronic baby settled in with all of her apps, tweaks, connected to my world, etc.  I realized immediately that while this is called a Samsung Galaxy Tab 3, it's nothing like the Samsung Galaxy S3 phone I have.  It's missing a lot of menu options, the cameras are very scaled down, the tablet is very difficult to hold because it's so slippery and light.  It's beautiful to look at but I felt like I needed something to grip on.  And finding a case for it is kind of a challenge as well.I knew almost immediately that this tablet wasn't for me.  It didn't feel right in my hands (which are small, even for a woman), the screen seemed so much smaller than my Nexus 7, though they were the same size.  The pictures were a bit fuzzy or hazy.  Loading pages took a lot longer than it should have with a brand new tablet, videos wouldn't play at all sometimes.  I couldn't figure it out because I hadn't changed anything, it was just that everything runs Soooooo Sloowww.  Page turns=slow, loading pages=slow  What a bummer.The screen had issues on it's own.  It seemed a bit off when I'd try to selected something to move it around, it wouldn't want to pick up the icon and move it..  Chrome loaded like I was on dial-upPros:Cute looking little tablet.  If you just want something for email, watch a movie, play a tame, it'll probably be oK.  But if you do anything else, you might be disappointed in this one, unless this is your step up into the big leagues of tablets, you'll most like enjoy this one just fine.It does connect through the Play store for lots of games and other apps..The negatives are:-Slow processor means slow everything.  I honestly got faster response time on the off-brand $40 tablets I've gotten for my youngest at ages 10 and 12-Very, very dainty and slick.  It weighs nothing and is very thin, it was really hard to find a way to hold it comfortably without feeling like it was going to slip'-Some apps and wepages took a long time to load.  That doesn't feel like a new tablet should feel, it's new!!  It should be like lighting!-The volume buttons are really hard to find, you have to keep feeling around to see where they are .  There's a lot more, but I have to sleep, we're expecting a huge snowstorm tomorrow and that could mean SNOW DAY!Bottom line:  If you have a Samsung Galaxy phone and think this is pretty much the same quality you are used to, you're going to be disappointed with this tablet.-

Reviews.Title: excellent sale
Reviews.Author: Oswald Barreto
Reviews.Content: Excellent sale, the products arrived the destination undamaged and smoothly. Sure you tell all my friends about you, my sincere congratulations

Reviews.Title: disappointing

Reviews.Content: so many things I love about this device, but the cons way outweigh the pros.  1) terrible battery life- I maybe got 6 hours max after a full charge.  2) crashes a lot, in fact, it completely died on me last night, so am going to try and return it today.  too bad- because I love the size and speed - finding it much nicer to use than my old Motoroal Xoom

Reviews.Title: So far, so good...
Reviews.Author: BriLa
Reviews.Content: I have had this tablet for a few days now and so far, so good. Beautiful display, good sound, very responsive, and it grabbed onto my wifi without a problem. Now, this may all change as time goes by, so this review is not set in concrete. If any problems arise, I will be sure to report them. I was quite leery about it due to some of the reviews I read, but so far, everything is working as it should. For a $200 tablet, I am pleased. :)

Reviews.Title: save your money

Reviews.Content: really slow and sluggish performance - not what i expected from Samsung- i hate how slow it is, i tried resetting it to factory setting and formating and erasing almost everything just to make it a bit better then i thought what the heck, why should i keep up with that ? and BTW i only use it for games and Hulu for my 5 years old daughter. :((

Reviews.Title: piece of crap.
Reviews.Author: Loria Kerr
Reviews.Content: Bought this tablet for Christmas. First the date and time kept resetting to Dec 31 2011. Won't connect to internet and I have to repeatedly press power button to turn it on. Barely used tablet. Just threw away my$$. I'm thinking amazon is selling refurbished electronics because ppl I know who bought this tablet from the electronic stores are not having this issue. Won't buy anymore electronics from amazon. Very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Price doesn't justify the negatives.
Reviews.Author: Matthew Ignoffo "Matty"
Reviews.Content: So so product. Can't see how it earns 5 stars from anyone. It's inexpensive, and runs games well. Everything else is below average IMO. Cameras stink. Screen is useless outdoors. Does not run smooth...kinda herky jerky IMO. Low storage space. Has occasional issues booting me out of applications, even readers occasionally which is terribly annoying because I lose my page.It is now Late May, 2014. Less than four months into buying two of these for a trip my wife and I took out of the country. My tablet has primarily been used as a reader because I can't stand the herky jerky nature of how it performs. The touch screen on mine does not work anymore. The tablet is ready for the garbage. No problem, I suppose....My wife uses her five year old ipad instead of this because it performs so much smoother, so I can just break hers now. Horrible product, Samsung.  Absolute shame becfause I LOVE my Galaxy S$ phone and think it outperforms apple on every level. This tablet is on par with the devices available at discount stores for <$100.00.

Reviews.Title: Disappointment
Reviews.Author: Maryam
Reviews.Content: Wow. One of the slowest tablets I have ever put my hands on. It takes so long to open up an app as well as closing it. Everything lags. I have two, for my siblings, and both of them are this way so it is not that they are defective. The design is nice considering its old design but man is this thing a disappointment. I am unimpressed this should be literally like $75 from how slow it is. In addition, I am very much in the tech world so it is not that I am unaware of this. Samsung should not sell products that are like this. I will definitely get an iPad mini instead.

Reviews.Title: christmas shopping
Reviews.Author: bkwife46
Reviews.Content: I love all products by samsung......Samsung is a really good product,anything by them has  a good product. I love Samsung products.

Reviews.Title: Gave it a chance... Huge disappointment. Returned.
Reviews.Author: Chad Hobgood
Reviews.Content: I have a 3rd gen iPad already, but got the 7" Tab 3 for free as part of a promotion when I bought my Samsung TV. At first I was excited about how compatible it could be with my tv with it's built in IR sensor. But that was heavily outweighed by it's less than stellar performance. It was very slow all around... opening apps, keyboard input, waking up. Sometimes when waking up the numbers on the clock would be all scrambled and unreadable. Maybe if I got one of the other two models with a faster processor it would have been better/faster. I think the only way I would have kept this was if I took the time to root it and customize it. But for now, I'm content with my iPad.

Reviews.Title: Get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: Marcus
Reviews.Content: This tablet isn't really the greatest. It could be worse but it could also be better buy I guess you get what you pay for. My only complaint is the speed. It's pretty slow most of the time. It takes a while to load web pages and it always buffers when I'm watching videos whether it's YouTube, Netflix or whatever I'm trying to watch. Another thing is the smart remote. When I try to use it, it glitches whenever I pull the tab to show the controls. Nothing is there. It's just a little tab in the middle of the screen. I would recommend saving your money and getting the galaxy note, nexus 7, or iPad mini.

Reviews.Title: GREAT
Reviews.Author: Jodi-Ann Mundell
Reviews.Content: So far I love it. Getting familiar with it's features tweaking the settings to my liking? The specs are awesome

Reviews.Title: It is just okay
Reviews.Author: CharlieO
Reviews.Content: I own a 2nd Gen Apple iPad and a Kindle Fire HD.  This product is not as intuitive to use as the iPad or Kindle Fire HD.  One constant issue is every time I try to load something to the external SD card, no matter how small the file, I get a message that the card is full.  I have to shut down and restart the Galaxy Tab 3 before I can add another file to the SD card.  I also cannot play music files loaded to the SD card.  They must be loaded into the internal memory.  So far I am not impressed.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet, missing a couple of features.
Reviews.Author: B. Carter
Reviews.Content: Received two Galaxy Tab 3s on July 8th thanks to Amazon Prime fast shipping.  One was the 7" model (for my Granddaughter) and an 8" (for myself).  Had no problems setting up /connecting either tablet.  My Granddaughter is eight years old and had no problems with any of the controls and is extremely delighted with the size of the screen compared to her iPod Touch. She has downloaded many games and other Aps from Google Play and everything works as advertised.  With that said, there are a couple of features that are present on the 8" model that I feel should have been included with the 7".  The first is the ability to transfer some Aps to the SD card.  Some (not all) Aps are developed with this capability and I think that Samsung should have allowed this on the 7" as it did on the 8".  The internal memory of the 7" is half that of the 8".  The other feature that is available on the 8" and not the 7" has been mentioned in several of the other reviews.  It is the ability to control the "Touch Key Light Duration".  I think a lot of owners would like the ability to have the lights on for a longer period or all the time.Note: In an attempt to get more information regarding the transfer of Aps to the SD card, I contacted Samsung through their "Chat" service.  After listening to my question, and doing some research, the Service Rep informed me that the 7" Tab 3 had the capability that I was questioning him about.  I told him that there were two identical Aps on each tablet.  I could transfer them on my 8" but not on the 7" in spite of both tablets having the same OS.  At that point the Rep said I should contact the developer of the Aps.  Needless to say, that ended "Chat".  A week later I decided to call Samsung.  Surprise!  I got to speak to a real life Human!  After a brief conversation and a not so brief "hold while I research", I was told "we don't know the answer but we will forward your question to the Tech Department".  I was given a transaction number that I'm sure is resting on the bottom of somebody's circular file.  Hopefully, in the future, they will  ad this feature to the 7" Tablets if it can be done with an update.

Reviews.Title: Invalid Package Files - and why I'll be Asking Amazon for A Return Authorization
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: UPDATE - INVALID PACKAGE FILE when updating apps or installing new ones work-around:Naviage to  [...] in your browswer and follow instructions about  Setting up VPN option.  Installs Hideman VPN (mine worked from Google Play.  Connect to any country then relaunch Google play.  and Voila you can update apps that had been failing with invalid package file - and most importantly I was successfully able to install Kindle.Should I have to do this.... absolutely not.  But comparing other devices seems they're all having issues.  (except of course Apple, but I'm just frugal but may surrender yet based on how well this solution works."--------------------Just purchased the Galaxy Tab 3 - and have so far spend an inordinate amount of time trying to get it to work.  The installation of an app update from the Google Play store generates  "Invalid package file".  Initially I was thinking this was simply an error  being thrown from download Amazon's Kindle; however the error also resulted from attempting to update any of the Google apps or the Samsung App.  [This is a replacement for a Kindle E-reader [not Fire], the Kindle had died and the owner [Rik]was ready to try a device where they could manage their calendar and take advantage of a tablet's capabilities.  [I'm the in-house IT guy performing the setup and am comfortable with the navigation/troubleshooting]After performing a complete factory reset (with the same results)  I contacted the Samsung technical service through Chat.  After variations of clearing cache, forcing stop, on chrome, google play the last suggestion was to try a different router - network congestion.  Seems unlikely since some apps will update successful.  The Help-Desk Analyst did seem very capable and understood the problem, but does not seem to have a ready solutionTotal time spent to setup, troubleshoot and still now have it NOT working is about 4 1/2 hours.  The time to get a return authorization for this Tab from Amazon will be much much shorter :)  I'm a Galaxy S3 phone user and love it - disappointed I don't have the same warm fuzzies with this device.

Reviews.Title: What is the difference from 7.0 plus and tab 3, a downgrade after 3 years of the 7.0 Plus
Reviews.Author: ccep22
Reviews.Content: I have the 7.0 Plus GT-P6210 Wi-Fi it has almost the same features as the Tab 3.  Speed 1.2 GHz and more internal memory (16GB) are better.  Tab 2 comes out and they reduce the memory to 8GB and the CPU to 1 GHz.  Then Tab 3 comes out and it is back to 1.2 GHz (yes dual core) just like the 7.0 Plus 2.5 years ago.  Why note a 1.5 GHz and put it back to 16 GB. Why not a better camera.  The 7.0 Plus has a front 2.0  Tab 3 1.3 megapixels.  Anything to compete at the $199 price with no real improvements to the unit itself.  It may look sleeker and lighter, it is a Dual core just like the 7.0 Plus, some other enhanced features, SD card expands to 64GB, that's good.  But it seems to lack major improvements and it is similar to the 7.0 Plus.  Nice but not that much better than its predecessors.

It will not charge with any other usb brick in our house or with a car usb charger.If you have an iPad or an iPhone you will find the user experience, at best, frustrating. If you are new to tablets you may be happy but I would recommend trying other tablets in your price point before you buy.

Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet just 2 days ago and already had to toggle wifi dozens of times, almost everytime I left it off and get back to it, wifi icon shows sending/receiving but no internet at all (with browser, Google Play, etc..). Once I toggle the wifi, it's all back. So disappointed, will return it tomorrow and might consider something else (Wasted all my time setting it up and personalizing it).UPDATE: I gave it another try, after returning it I bought another copy from a different store, hoping it's a hit-and-miss kind of thing... Too bad, exactly the same issue again, 2 in a row!As this is a brand new device, I don't want to remember tricks just to make it to work. Samsung quality control (if they even exist) supposed to take care of this before they release the products. I'm returning it and buying a different brand...UPDATE: I plugged it in Kies and got prompted for an update. After the update, the wifi issue seems to be resolved. Been using it for about 1 week without any problem. Although, still no flash player!

Return again, and yep, you guessed it same results!!!  I've owned the tablet for almost 4 months, used it less than 4 days, and would have rather thrown my money out the window.  This is complete junk, DO NOT BUY!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Decent book reader and other recreational uses
Reviews.Author: Thomas W. Day "T.W. Day"
Reviews.Content: I bought my Tab 3 7" unit on a special end-of-production buyout for about $99 shipped. That's pretty much what I've found the tablet is worth to me. It is an excellent back-lit eBook reader with the added bonus of being completely compatible with 3M's Cloud Library system and Adobe's Digital editions library system. For those purposes alone, I think my tablet has paid for itself in saved trips to the library, late fees, and book purchase costs.With a micro-USB adapter, it can be used as a half-decent laptop with the addition of a decent wireless keyboard. The screen is readable from a moderate distance and the processor is certainly fast enough for word-processing or other business software work using the included Polaris Office (compatible with MS Office) software.

Reviews.Title: Stops working, date changes, slow
Reviews.Author: mandamarierose
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my son for Christmas and wish I would have splurged for something else.  This device stops working in the middle of an app or game.  It has slow response time and often will not work at all.  I finally figured out after googling it, that this is common because the device decides on it's own to change the date and time back three years, then the tablet can't recognize what you are doing.  So I have had to manually go in at least 10 times now and fix it when it does that.  Next time I will go with Apple.

Reviews.Title: Memory issues 3 months after purchase. Extended warranty useless.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Wasn't planning on reviewing this but since I bought it from Amazon back in December and they insist on sending me information about how I can buy one as though I've never heard of it before here you go. It was running fine for a couple of months, nothing special nothing bad. Then it started to have memory issues. It would randomly power down and when I turned it back on the date and time would be reset to 7pm Dec 31st, 2011. Not sure what's so special about that date, pretty sure it was well before they started making these.I got the extended warranty that Amazon recommended from SquareTrade. Thus far they've proven themselves to be a frustratingly useless company. Basic website issues, limited responses with long waits, and unnecessary hoop jumping all included.I hope this helps.

I called Samsung and they said it was still under warranty. I had to ship it to them and they will fix it, but now I am without a tablet for a week so far. I am very dissatisfied and think Samsung should have just sent me a new tablet since this one was only 4 months old. I will not buy any more Samsung products.

It also has a slot for a SD chip, the kind that doesnt have this feature with othe rpopular tablets such as hp.All in all, I love samsung. Cheers to them I am a diehearted lover of their products. Reviews.Author: Melida Sottong
Reviews.Content: Device challenged, I bought this tablet after reviewing the list of devices that would support a "Square or Jax".  It does not support these e-commerce additions because it was the wrong version.  I was disappointed but realized I could input credit cards manually so decided to keep it and upgrade later.  However, my Son may be right, Apple products may be more suitable.  I noticed it has a pretty short battery life.  Not what I had hoped for and wish I hadn't bought another one at the same time as a gift.  Think I'll return the second one.

Reviews.Title: One caveat
Reviews.Author: William J. Bauman
Reviews.Content: When earphones are plugged into this device, the sound is transferred from the device to the headset. Logical? Of course. When setting an alarm and subsequently plugging in the headphones, the sound is NOT transferred but remains with the external speakers rendering the alarm completely useless unless somebody sitting near you get annoyed and wakes you. I contacted Samsung because I thought there had to be a way of redirecting the alarm sound. Nope! Can't do that. I didn't say it to them, but to me this is just stupid. With the Nook, I read and listen to music during my commute. The alarm awakes me so I don't sleep through my stop. Common sense would say that all devices work in this manner but not this one. Plus there is no way of knowing this until after you have purchased the device.Other than the above, this is a wonderful tablet and I love it. Problem is I can't use it during my commute so do I carry two devices? Nope. This one is left at home.

Reviews.Title: Avoid. Misrepresentation!
Reviews.Author: Duolos
Reviews.Content: I picked up this little tablet on sale, excited that my first tablet would be a well-received Samdung product. I have the S2 for my phone and love it.My first impression was positive. Fairly speedy, brilliant screen. HOWEVER - I will be returning it after less than a week of use. The reason? You only have 8GB of storage for apps. Thats it. Yes, it has a slot for an external SD card, but what the ads dont tell you is that you still arent permitted to use that extra space to install or move apps to it.After installing only 10 apps or so, only a couple of those being games, my device is full. And no, it doesn't help to root the tablet or install custom ROMs. This is due to how Samsung setup the hardware; it EMULATES the sd csrd. No work around!Just wanted to write a review to warn others that if you plan to install apps, this is NOT a good tablet to use!

Reviews.Title: Waste of money, terrible product
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: A total waste of money, this thing is cheap looking, slow, and unresponsive. Games freeze, the camera is awful, and mine won't even charge anymore. $200 dollars down the drain, I hope Samsung's happy. DO NOT BUY THIS, you'll regret it.

Reviews.Title: terrible
Reviews.Author: mb
Reviews.Content: i can not figure out how to use the external memory card. freezes up constantly. hardly any digital movies are compatible. this is very slow. i am very disapointed with this product. if i could get my money back i would

Reviews.Title: Really good product
Reviews.Author: Oscar Jimenez Mena
Reviews.Content: I really want to encourage you to make the decision of buying this product. I'm very pleased with both quality and delivery time. No complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: Nice Interface - Terrible browser performance
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I sold my iPad and bought this Tab3, because the iPad was too bulky for my use.NEGATIVESPoor WiFi reception.  All our WiFi portable devices (Apple and Android) have much better range from our WiFi access points in our home.-Very slow at loading any web page in Chrome or default Browser.  Even Google search pages take 3 times as long as on our Android phones or Apple devices.-Web pages don't scroll well.  Its hard to read an article or browse a web page that require scrolling, because the scroll feature is so Jerky and delayed.  Its terrible. Based on someone's comment about this post, I just did a performance comparison between my 2010 Samsung Vibrant phone and my 2013 TAB3. The 2010 phone's browswer loading and scrolling is excellent . . almost as good as my S4.-POSITIVESI have always like the Samsung interface and have had every Galaxy phone released.-Samsung supports Video codecs that Google branded products do not support and I find the Galaxy interface more user friendly in many ways.OVERALLI wish I hadn't bought this tablet, because of it terrible browser performance.

Reviews.Title: Micro SD card frustrations.
Reviews.Author: NEIL SARJEANT
Reviews.Content: The ratings would have been higher but I have a problem with the micro sd card port. Ive tried a 2gb, a 16gb and an 8gb micro sd card, they work long enough for me to store important pics and documents to the card, then the tablet warns me that the card is corrupted or unreadable or empty. I take out the card and place it in my phone and hey presto, all the info is available. Totally frustrated with this thing. And as the 7 inch tab 3 only has 8gb internal, and less han 5gb available, im in a jam.

Reviews.Title: Nothing special!
Reviews.Author: Ray B
Reviews.Content: After owning an iPad for several years, i found this Samsung product to be disappointing at best. .It does what i need it to do, but if i had it to do over i would probably spend the extra $100 and get the iPad mini.

Reviews.Title: Battery was dead
Reviews.Author: hadi
Reviews.Content: I bought Galaxy tab and the battery was dead. I would charged, and it would show 100% but it will be dead again after five minutes, even before five minutes. I do understand when i buy something used it won't be like a new one, however, they know how the battery is important in tablets. So i hope that they will focus on important things such as battery more that cosmetics.

Reviews.Title: suitable for my purposes
Reviews.Author: misplacedpoptart
Reviews.Content: When I grabbed this at Best Buy I told the rep named Jimmy "when Steve Jobs creates the next gen of Galaxy devices it's gonna be so rad" and he scowled at me incredulously. But I was like "what? did I offended you?" And he said " Steve Jobs is dead, he won't be around to make the next generation of Galaxy devices anymore." And I was like "woah, no way,  what happened?" And the guy told me the story of how Steve Jobs died in an industrial accident at the lumber mill, and how the locals say on the full moon you can see his ghost pining away for his lost love Charlie Sheen.

Reviews.Content: Well,I am not happy, first, I ordered a mothern i9500 and inset I got i9505, i was so excited that i decided to leave it like that some of the items that i have bought here they brought payment receipt and some of them not, like my movile My Phone updated and everything became s*** my apps dont work properly so i think someone could give me a warning for that cus i didnt know what s happen if i update my android SO and that s why i feel unhappy with my phone the wi fi doesnt work i have to reset the phone to use it and the IMEI is broken so i cant have a phone number for i just can use my phone like a PSP pffftt.........

Reviews.Author: Ray Kent "rrkentjr"
Reviews.Content: I bought two phones. One of them has a bad display. I am going to see if I can exchange it.

Reviews.Title: here I am
Reviews.Author: Emily A. Wrathall
Reviews.Content: Super excited about my first tab, and it'll be just like my phone, which I freaking love. Yeah...Not so much. It's glichy and slow, and has done some really concerning things- like shut down and reboot and be at factory settings with none of my purchased apps! I rebooted it, and they were magically there. Just a weird thing. Also, none of the accessories I've bought for it fit. (and I made sure they were the right ones!) They're all to big and floppy, with holes in the wrong place. I love my galaxy phone, with all my heart. I just wish my tab was as fast and with it as my phone. It's the slow stupid version it seems. Poopy.

Reviews.Content: Is fabricated in  vietnam and no have sim . No is good in the description sayd that the tablet has a sim. Recived in my country tablet without sim

Reviews.Title: Samsung Galaxy Tab 3 - Not worth the wait... still waiting...
Reviews.Author: mrtraps
Reviews.Content: I purchased this tablet hoping to find a cost effective, FUNCTIONAL alternative to using a smartphone screen.The shipping was as advertised; the appearance of the tablet was nice. Once I started using the device I almost immediately became dissatisfied. The applications take forever to load. The internet runs so slowly that it is barely usable. The internet connection consistently locks up, requiring the user to go back to the home screen. Over-all performance of this product was disappointing at best.Now the fun part...After receiving an e-mail from both Amazon and ADARAMA CAMERA giving me permission to return the product due to performance issues, ADARAMA CAMERA then told me over the phone (had to call and wait on hold for ten minutes to get their shipping address) that I could not return the tablet and that I would have to deal with Samsung directly. Mind you - I have had this tablet for less than two weeks. The only thing I will definitely emphasize is that if customer service is a priorty, DO NOT ORDER ANYTHING FROM ADARAMA CAMERA !!!S. Trapnell

Reviews.Title: this product is not good at all I cant use it for a month before it's damaged
Reviews.Author: semui balogun
Reviews.Content: Because IDont enjoyed itI can't tell any body to buy itI return it and I dony see my money till now.

Reviews.Content: Owned less than a week and went to repair. Owned less than a month and went to repair for a second time.  Both times for the same problem... not able to charge.

Reviews.Title: Egh
Reviews.Author: Mister Ca
Reviews.Content: Neutral rating, I ordered this for a birthday gift last month. The recipient never got the package, it says it was delivered but never was at the correct adress. Opened a postal claim ourself etc and contacted the company about it. They came off a little nice but tried having me do a charge back on my  credit card...that's against amazons policy and they knew that. I was refunded and bought another for my gf from Anazon. They are not to blame for the shipping error, but I dislike there honesty with claims.

Reviews.Title: Buy any other tablet but not the Galaxy
Reviews.Author: Charles A. Field Jr. "Chuck Tech"
Reviews.Content: This tablet is slow and unresponsive.  The screen does not respond well to touch.  The processor is so slow that you type things twice.  The lag time is terrible.  When you are on wifii you have to wait a long time for response.  I have ipad, nexus 7, kindle fire and the Microsoft surface.  Any of those other 4 are far superior.  Dont waste your time with this galaxy it is horrendously slow.  If you need a cheap tablet for the kids, get them an XO or one of the 4 tabllets listed above.  Ranked from best to worst 1. ipad (any ipad), 2. Nexus 7, 3. surface, 4. kindle fire.

Reviews.Content: Awful product. The worst samsung that I ever had. System operates very slow, the screen constantly no response. This samsung couldn't give me any pleasure, not as good as other samsung products, not practical at all. I am prepare to send it back and get a refund.Whoever read this should consider to buy a kindle or nexus 7.0 or samsung tab 3 8.0

Reviews.Content: i WISH IT CAME WITH AN USERS MANUAL, AS IT IS I HAVE TO DOWNLOAD IT BUT OTHERWISE I LOVE IT (GUSHY SOUNDING)BUT I AM SURE I AM NOT UTILIZING ALL OF IT'S FUNCTIONS

Reviews.Content: When I saw that is a new model, I expected more. The galaxy 3 is ok, but could be better

Reviews.Title: One tablet defective
Reviews.Author: Gmk "Mitch"
Reviews.Content: Bought two of these for my 19 and 21 year old granddaughters as Christmas gifts. Both girls were very excited about the gift, especially because it's a Samsung. Now the tablet will not come on after recharging and she's heartbroken. I bought a Samsung because of their reputation for producing great products. Very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: huge disappointment
Reviews.Author: Ed Ganza
Reviews.Content: I have another, no name tablet, that cost half as much and performs twice as good! Too many software glitches to evenlist. Reading some 5 star ratings makes it obvious they were made by paid professionals. I would gladly return it for a 50% refund. The first time you go to the internet the registration form appears and NEVER goes away, even if you open a new tab it appears there. Support e-mailed me instructions to remove it but of course that didn't work. I tried to reset to factory specs but the second it's finished it immediately reloads everything that you wanted to get rid of without user input. Does not accept most user preferred settings and many times e-mail confirmed as sent acctually isn't ! I'll go back to my $75 tablet and let the Tab 3 set and collect dust.

Reviews.Title: Did not work
Reviews.Author: Jayne Moehr
Reviews.Content: I have concerns about the return policy. I cannot get the tablet to work and have not been able to return the item. We are very, very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: Ricsi Canas
Reviews.Content: I'm really happy, I love it, the size is perfect, the color is so cute, I can't said more because I don't have the time to use it yet

Reviews.Title: WHERE IS THE CASE?
Reviews.Author: AAppleton
Reviews.Content: I thought there was a promise to send with the item other accessories including a case.Please confirm.Other than that the item is quite handy and useful and so far does what it was bought to do.

Reviews.Title: Returned after 2 weeks.
Reviews.Author: Sean Anders
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to like this. The Tab 3 was my first Android device since I moved from the iPhone.The first thing I didn't like was moving back to a lower-resolution screen after having become accustomed to the Retina displays of Apple products. Next, and this is my biggest gripe, I found the user interface to be clunky and ugly. For example, the idea of program widgets is clever, but they do not blend in well with the overall look of the OS. There seems to be no standard design, it looks mashed together. iOS was much more polished and visually appealing.The way the programs were put into different screens was also annoying. In iOS you have up to X main screen where all the programs are listed. On this device there was a separate screen where all your downloaded programs would be listed, then you would have your "home" screens. You had to either make a shortcut from the all-programs screen to one of your home screen or just browse the all-programs screen. Breaking programs up this was seemed completely unnecessary.Having been on iOS now for several years, I refuse to repurchase apps on Android that I already bought on Apple's App Store.

Reviews.Title: Nice but...
Reviews.Author: Ascaris
Reviews.Content: I would have been greatly in love with this tablet had it not been for the capacitative buttons not lighting up.I have the white version.Normally I wouldnt mind little details and I usually love Samsung products. BUT someone dropped the ball big time on this.The tablet is great, its a lot faster and smoother than my Tab 2 7.0 which I love by the way.. Both are small, compact and light weight. Perfect size for me since Im on the move a lot.The new Tab 3 7.0 is even smaller even tho it still maintains the same screen size at7". And also the memory is upgradable via micro SD.But the most annoying issue I have is that the capacitative buttons dont light up, meaning that if you are in a room with low light, it is near impossible to see where the back button and the menu button are.I thought I would love those button not being on the screen itself but it really gets old when while watching a video or even surfing the web or playing in an app and accidentally hitting one of those button since they are not discernable from the frame.In a well lit up room or outside in a sunny day it isnt such an issue since the buttons are grayish outlined. But in a car or a plane where light can be low the whole thing turn gray and cannot see where the buttons are.Now people might think Im just being too overly negative about this issue but for what I bought this upgrade it just isnt working. I hate it, I HATE IT! Always accidentaly touching these invisible buttons. I would have much rather love for them to just leave them inside the screen.And I cannot even let my 2 year old play with it since she cannot tell the buttons arent there. On the tab2 she can see the those button and the home button since they are on screen and she knows what they do. On this one, she keeps getting kicked out of her apps and she thinks something is wrong with the tablet. She like the tab2 better obviously.And the worst part is that I tried looking up if this was due to a deffective product or the tablet is just made that way and even the rep couldnt give me a straight answer telling me that this tablet is made just like the Note and that the buttons light up but not bright, that it depends on the brightness of the screen. wait WHAT? That doesn't even make sense.Also looked up in the options to see if there was an option to turn those on but nothing.If I had the option, I'd just wait for the Nexus or something else, but if this issue does not bother you, Id definitely recommend it to you. As for me, I will explore my options.Update after 3 days with the Unit:2nd day of use and The unit seems to have issues with Wifi connection. Cannot connect to the Play store, but the web browser works just fine. As of yesterday it will not even connect to the Wifi while my tab 2 gets connection. I will try to do a factory reset and see where it takes me. Also it seems to have a issue when hooked up via Aux cable and there is a loud noise (for exemple an explosion or a shout especially while watching an action movie) the sound messes up and I have to unplug the Aux cable and plug it again. Yeah those are definitly too many issues with my unit.I understand that my review score might be a little too harsh to some, but Again, for what I bought this unit for, it is not serving its purpose so it is useless to me so far.Update After day 5:Yeah my unit is pure garbage at this point. Now it won't even connect to my laptop. It keeps restring or shutting off and just showing the charging battery. I'm done with this, returning the unit and giving it another shot but I'm not hoping for much here.I'm still not happy about the Capacitative buttons, but not much can be done here. The rest I'm sure is either I have a defective unit or its just a software issue that hopefully Samsung can fix with updates.I'm hoping I'm the only one with these issues as the Samsung rep told me he's never heard of the unit underperforming like that.All in all, There is much to like about this tablet, but right now with my experience now turning sour I would have to give it a 0 star. I've got a brick on my hand.

Reviews.Title: Samsung -never again!!!!
Reviews.Author: Miroslav
Reviews.Content: The touch screen is not sensitive enough. Poor catches wi-fi signal. I do not know how to turn back ...

Reviews.Title: Too slow

Reviews.Content: I liked it at first . But then after visiting some web sites I found out this tablet is so slow that it feels like we are back to dial up . So frustrating to spend $ 200 on this when I could add just $ 100 and get a real apple . Tablet must be apple , there is no other way . All others are imitation . Now I will have to save more money . I like the size , features and design of Samsung . But the speed for internet is really annoying . And I've tested in many places . Its not my connection . Besides that , we have to wait to load , load , load when turning on . Just like an old desktop . 2 stars are for the design only . Every time I use my samsung I feel the urge to throw on the floor and break it in million pieces . I will give mine away to someone in the family.

Reviews.Title: Underpower tablet S3, S4, Note II can easily beat

Reviews.Content: The tablet is slow, though beautifully constructed.  The same app ran significantly faster in my Note II.  Bluetooth connection has some issues.  Don't recommend it.

Reviews.Content: It was so frustrating. I was just waiting for it....  And i have to change de color because thisone was out of stock..thankfully thy send me another one when i reported. And this new want works really amaizinly...im gonna put just 3 stars because of the incovenient.But the tab is just amaizing
